triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs are the core technology that the paper re-purposes for synthesizing robot policy code from natural language commands.

triples.name: Python (programming language)
triples.relevance: Python is the primary language used for expressing and writing robot policy code in this approach.

triples.name: Object detection
triples.relevance: Object detectors provide perception outputs that policy code processes to make control decisions.

triples.name: Few-shot learning
triples.relevance: Few-shot prompting is the core technique used to teach LLMs to generate new policy code from examples.

triples.name: NumPy
triples.relevance: NumPy library is used for arithmetic and mathematical operations within generated robot policy code.

triples.name: Code generation
triples.relevance: The paper proposes hierarchical code generation as a novel approach for writing robot policies through language models.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: NLP techniques enable the LLM to interpret natural language commands and translate them into executable robot policy code.

triples.name: Robot control
triples.relevance: Robot control is the primary task domain where the proposed Code as Policies framework is applied.

triples.name: Prompt engineering
triples.relevance: Prompt engineering through hierarchical code-gen examples is the key technique for guiding LLMs to generate correct policy code.

triples.name: Transformer (deep learning)
triples.relevance: Transformer architecture underlies the large language models used for code generation in this work.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: Reinforcement learning concepts relate to the reactive control policies demonstrated in the paper.

triples.name: Vision-language-action model
triples.relevance: The paper contributes to the development of vision-language models that connect natural language understanding to robot control actions.

triples.name: Robot learning
triples.relevance: Robot learning through language-guided policy synthesis is the core problem being addressed.
